body:
**Bug Template**

*Title*: Crash with "use_websocket": true on trunk

*Description*:

envoy crashes on trunk (tested with f0af99c0fffd69e73f8c8c0757373729b0f970db on macOS) when WebSockets are enabled, and a particular traffic pattern is sent.

*Repro steps*:

Launch Envoy with:
```shell
$ bazel-bin/source/exe/envoy-static -c /tmp/ws-crash.json --service-cluster A --service-node B
```
using the config below.

Then send data using [tcpkali](https://github.com/satori-com/tcpkali), as follows:
```shell
$ tcpkali --ws 127.1:1111 -1 "hey" --channel-lifetime=0.1s --channel-lifetime=0.1s --channel-lifetime=0.1s
```

Envoy will immediately crash.

*Config*:
```json
{
  "listeners": [
    {
      "address": "tcp://127.0.0.1:1111",
      "filters": [
        {
          "type": "read",
          "name": "http_connection_manager",
          "config": {
            "codec_type": "http1",
            "stat_prefix": "whatever",
            "route_config": {
              "virtual_hosts": [
                {
                  "name": "whatever",
                  "domains": ["*"],
                  "routes": [
                    {
                      "prefix": "/",
                      "use_websocket": true,
                      "cluster": "whatever"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            },
            "filters": [
              {
                "type": "decoder",
                "name": "router",
                "config": {}
              }
            ]
          }
        }
        ]
    }
  ],
  "admin": {
    "access_log_path": "/dev/null",
    "address": "tcp://127.0.0.1:8001"
  },
  "cluster_manager": {
    "sds": {
      "cluster": {
        "name": "sds",
        "connect_timeout_ms": 1000,
        "type": "static",
        "lb_type": "least_request",
        "hosts": [ { "url": "tcp://127.0.0.1:443" } ]
      },
      "refresh_delay_ms": 15000    
    },
    "clusters": [
      {
        "name": "whatever",
        "connect_timeout_ms": 1000,
        "type": "sds",
        "service_name": "whatever",
        "lb_type": "round_robin"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

*Logs*:
```
 bazel-bin/source/exe/envoy-static -c /tmp/ws-crash.json --service-cluster A --service-node B
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.862][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:200] initializing epoch 0 (hot restart version=disabled)
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.863][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:202] statically linked extensions:
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.863][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:204]   access_loggers: envoy.file_access_log,envoy.http_grpc_access_log
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.863][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:207]   filters.http: envoy.buffer,envoy.cors,envoy.ext_authz,envoy.fault,envoy.grpc_http1_bridge,envoy.grpc_json_transcoder,envoy.grpc_web,envoy.gzip,envoy.health_check,envoy.http_dynamo_filter,envoy.ip_tagging,envoy.lua,envoy.rate_limit,envoy.router,envoy.squash
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.863][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:210]   filters.listener: envoy.listener.original_dst,envoy.listener.proxy_protocol,envoy.listener.tls_inspector
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.863][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:213]   filters.network: envoy.client_ssl_auth,envoy.echo,envoy.ext_authz,envoy.http_connection_manager,envoy.mongo_proxy,envoy.ratelimit,envoy.redis_proxy,envoy.tcp_proxy
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.864][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:215]   stat_sinks: envoy.dog_statsd,envoy.metrics_service,envoy.statsd
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.864][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:217]   tracers: envoy.dynamic.ot,envoy.lightstep,envoy.zipkin
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.864][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:220]   transport_sockets.downstream: raw_buffer,ssl
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.864][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:223]   transport_sockets.upstream: raw_buffer,ssl
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.888][24590546][info][upstream] source/common/upstream/cluster_manager_impl.cc:108] cm init: initializing secondary clusters
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.889][24590546][info][config] source/server/configuration_impl.cc:52] loading 1 listener(s)
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.900][24590546][info][config] source/server/configuration_impl.cc:92] loading tracing configuration
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.900][24590546][info][config] source/server/configuration_impl.cc:114] loading stats sink configuration
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.905][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:399] starting main dispatch loop
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.908][24590546][info][upstream] source/common/upstream/cluster_manager_impl.cc:131] cm init: all clusters initialized
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.908][24590546][info][main] source/server/server.cc:383] all clusters initialized. initializing init manager
[2018-04-26 16:21:19.908][24590546][info][config] source/server/listener_manager_impl.cc:602] all dependencies initialized. starting workers
```

*Call Stack*:

Envoy immediately crashes with the following backtrace:
```
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.460][24590562][critical][assert] source/common/http/websocket/ws_handler_impl.cc:53] assert failure: queued_data_.length() == 0
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.460][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:114] Caught Abort trap: 6, suspect faulting address 0x7fff74b1fb6e
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.463][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:87] Backtrace obj<envoy-static> thr<123145494134784>:
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.463][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:99] thr<123145494134784> obj<envoy-static                        0x0000000106230c66 _ZN8backward7details6unwindINS_14StackTraceImplINS_10system_tag10darwin_tagEE8callbackEEEmT_m>
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.463][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:105] thr<123145494134784> #0 0x106230c66: 
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.463][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:99] thr<123145494134784> obj<envoy-static>
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.463][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:105] thr<123145494134784> #1 0x1062307d5: backward::StackTraceImpl<backward::system_tag::darwin_tag>::load_here(unsigned long) + 101
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.489][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:105] thr<123145494134784> #2 0x1062305d1: backward::StackTraceImpl<backward::system_tag::darwin_tag>::load_from(void*, unsigned long) + 49
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.489][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:105] thr<123145494134784> #3 0x10622eb2e: Envoy::BackwardsTrace::captureFrom(void*) + 46
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.489][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:105] thr<123145494134784> #4 0x10622e9ef: Envoy::SignalAction::sigHandler(int, __siginfo*, void*) + 143
[2018-04-26 16:23:22.489][24590562][critical][backtrace] bazel-out/darwin-fastbuild/bin/source/server/_virtual_includes/backtrace_lib/server/backtrace.h:110] end backtrace thread 123145494134784
Abort trap: 6
```
title: Crash with "use_websocket": true on trunk
